cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest through the Bahamas, forecast to turn north-northwest and parallel the Florida east coast, then skirt the Georgia-South Carolina coast and approach the southeastern North Carolina shoreline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along or very near the Florida east coast between Cape Canaveral and Jacksonville

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Fernandina Beach FL to Edisto Beach SC (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Golden Beach FL to Fernandina Beach FL (Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through Georgia, South Carolina and into southeastern North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph, gusts higher) increasingly likely with a 47 % 5-day chance; small (17 %) chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow could push 3–5 ft of surge into the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent beaches if the center tracks close to the coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands may drop 4–8 inches, producing flash-flood potential in the Wilmington area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, minor coastal erosion
